intro: Atraphaxis binaludensis, commonly known as the Binalud sandmat, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of Iran. It belongs to the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming structure. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically greenish or yellowish in color. Its leaves are succulent, adapted to store water in its native dry environment. Atraphaxis binaludensis is well-suited to sandy and rocky soils, making it a resilient species in harsh climates.
